page.title: 15Religion Flintham/Syerston.
page.content:
{Flintham church}is linked with Car Colston and Screveton and is without a vicar at the moment. The church, not visible from the Main Street, is in close proximity to Flintham Hall and until 1985 had a Georgian vicarage when it was sold to Flintham Hall Estate. A modern vicarage is being built in Woods Lane, to the chagrin of most of the village. The congregation rarely reaches double figures and it is debateable whether the new vicar will improve numbers.{The Chapel}in Spring Lane has a handful of retired people who meet in one of their homes in the winter where it is warmer.
{Syerston's church}on their Main Street is linked with Sibthorpe, Elston, East Stoke and Shelton. Their congregation is frequently one lady with her goat.
